title: 88/149/EEC: Commission Decision of 11 December 1987 on the multiannual guidance programme for the fishing fleet (1987 to 1991) forwarded by Spain pursuant to Regulation (EEC) No 4028/86 (Only the Spanish text is authentic)
header:
COMMISSION  DECISION
of 11 December 1987
on the multiannual guidance programme for the fishing fleet (1987 to 1991) forwarded by Spain pursuant to Regulation (EEC) No 4028/86
(Only the Spanish text is authentic)
(88/149/EEC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: The multiannual guidance programme for the fishing fleet (1987 to 1991), as forwarded by the Spanish Government on 29 April 1987 and as later supplemented by that Government, is hereby approved subject to the limitations and conditions set out in this Decision and provided that those limitations and conditions are complied with.

Each year, at the latest by 15 February and 31 July, Spain shall forward to the Commission, in respect of each category of vessels defined in the programme, and by 'autonomous Community' information on the number of vessels commissioned and withdrawn and on the tonnage and engine power added and withdrawn during the six-month period ending on the preceding 31 December or 30 June.

The approval referred to in Article 1 shall only be effective where the development of the fleet complies with the objectives of the programme as set out in the Annex hereto.
The Commission shall, on the basis of its assessment of the information provided on a regular basis as specified in Article 2 or, where this information is repeatedly not supplied, notify the Member State, at the end of two consecutive six-month periods, that it has been found that the conditions to which approval of the programme was made subject have not been fulfilled.
This Decision shall be without prejudice to any Community financial aid that may be granted to individual investment projects.
This Decision is addressed to the Kingdom of Spain.

ANNEX
Multiannual guidance programme for the Spanish fishing fleet (1987 to 1991)
I. GENERAL REMARKS
The programme covers the whole of the Spanish fishing fleet and concerns the whole of the territory of this Member State including the Canaries, Ceuta and Melilla in conformity with the provisions of Article 50 of Regulation (EEC) No 4028/86.
II. OBJECTIVES
1. The aims of the programme are:
(a) a reduction in the entire active fishing fleet at a level of 648 607 GRT and 2 088 783 kW;
(b) a restructuring by renewal of all the sections of the fleet of about 15 % of the boats having a length between perpendiculars of between 6 and 9 or 12 metres and a renewal of about a third of the boats with a length between perpendiculars above 9 or 12 metres;
(c) to modernize existing vessels without increasing the individual tonnage and engine power of the vessels.

The following measures should be implemented to achieve the objectives set out above:
1. Fleet in activity operating in Community waters:
(a) a reduction in the global capacity of boats operating in the Atlantic coastal band in conformity with the objectives set out in the above table;
(b) a more pronounced reduction in the global capacity of vessels operating in the Mediterranean within the limit of the objectives set out in the above table;
(c) an evolution conforming to the exigencies of the Act of Accession and in particular Article 159, for fleets operating under the conditions set out in Articles 157 to 160.
2. Fleet in activity operating in third country coastal waters: reduction of the global capacity of boats expressed in tonnage and horsepower, within the limits set out in the above table.
3. Tuna fleet in activity: stabilization at the level of 1 January 1987.
IV. COMMENTS
1. The overall objective referred to in point II (1) (a) above and the objectives for each category of vessels in the fleet set out in the above tables may only be revised on the basis of detailed scientific assessments that show the existence of stocks which are not fully exploited at present.
2. At least 10 % of the programme objectives should be achieved by the end of 1988 at least 30 % by the end of 1989 and at least 80 % by the end of 1990.
3. The Commission recalls that any structural financial measures taken by the national, regional or local authorities in respect of the sector concerned must henceforth lie within the scope of this programme.
